CatDescriptText: Miss Shirley Ellis, restaurant clerk, 2325 Reed Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "Yes, I do, because it is a pretty hard task getting along with the public. Waitresses run into all kinds of people.  I think they should get at least $1 an hour and their tips."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Shirley Ellis wearing light colored short sleeve blouse with bow at collar and corduroy pants, standing on sidewalk in front of row houses
